org.jpws.pwslib.data

Class PwsPassphrase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public final class PwsPassphrase
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    PwsPassphrase represents a sequence of characters which is especially protected against uncoverage through attacking tools analysing the JVM memory. By the design of this class, there is always a cryptographic cipher defined for an instance, ensuring that at any time the passphrase value can be both stored encrypted and retrieved decrypted.

    All functions are "waste clean", i.e. after retrieving a decrypted value from an instance, the returned value is the only object in memory produced by this class and containing a decrypted form of the value. It is then in the responsibility of the caller to handle decrypted values with care.

      • PwsPassphrase

        public PwsPassphrase(byte[] buffer,
                     java.lang.String enc)
        Constructor from a byte array containing binary serialisation of a character sequence with the given encoding.
        Parameters:
        buffer - an array of byte containing the initial value for this PP as an encoded character sequence.
        enc - the charset to which the content of the buffer is encoded; null for VM default charset
        Throws:
        java.nio.charset.IllegalCharsetNameException - if the given charset name is illegal
        java.nio.charset.UnsupportedCharsetException - if no support for the named charset is available in this instance of the Java virtual machine

      • setValue

        public void setValue(char[] value)
        Sets the value of this instance from the (cleartext) parameter char array. A copy of the parameter is used.
        Parameters:
        value - array of char, the new value for this PP or null to clear

      • setValue

        public void setValue(char[] buffer,
                     int start,
                     int length)
        Sets the value of this instance from the cleartext parameter char array, comprising length characters starting from index start. A copy of the data section is used.
        Parameters:
        buffer - char array, source data for the new value or null to clear
        start - int starting offset in buffer
        length - int selected data length in buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if section settings are invalid

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes(java.lang.String enc)
        Returns the decrypted value of this passphrase as an array of bytes. The conversion of the internal character representation to the sequence of bytes follows the encoding charset as specified by the parameter.
        Parameters:
        enc - String charset name for encoding; null for VM default
        Returns:
        array of bytes containing the encoded sequence of characters forming this passphrase
        Throws:
        java.nio.charset.IllegalCharsetNameException - if the given charset name is illegal
        java.nio.charset.UnsupportedCharsetException - if no support for the given charset is available

      • getValue

        public char[] getValue()
        Returns the decrypted value of this passphrase as an array of char. If this value is void, an array of length 0 is returned.
        Returns:
        array of char of the active length of he stored value, i.e. identical with getLength()

      • getValueBuffer

        protected byte[] getValueBuffer()
        Returns the value of this passphrase as a decrypted version of the internal stored buffer. The content reflects only the active length of passphrase (so the resulting length should be getLength() * 2).
        Returns:
        array of bytes

      • getEncryptedBlock

        public byte[] getEncryptedBlock(PwsCipher cph)
        Returns the encrypted data block of this passphrase as an array of bytes, encrypted by the cipher given with the parameter or by the internal cipher if the parameter is null.

        The resulting array object is always separate from the internal value.

        Parameters:
        cph - PwsCipher by which the returned block will be encrypted; this may differ from the cipher used for storing this value. If null the internal cipher is used instead.
        Returns:
        encrypted array of bytes

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        The length of the stored value in number of characters.
        Returns:
        int length of text value

      • getStringBuffer

        public java.lang.StringBuffer getStringBuffer()
        Returns the decrypted value of this passphrase as a StringBuffer.
        Returns:
        StringBuffer

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString()
        Returns the decrypted value of this passphrase as a String. If this value is void, an empty string is returned.

        !!WARNING!! Returned undestoyable, uncovered password value constitutes a security threat! It might not be ultimately avoidable though in certain environments, but it should be used as sparingly as possible.

        Returns:
        String decrypted text value

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Whether the value of this passphrase is empty.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • getCipher

        protected PwsCipher getCipher()
        Returns the encryption cipher used by this passphrase.
        Returns:
        PwsCipher

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Whether the parameter object equals this instance. Two PwsPassphrase objects are equal if and only if their cleartext values are equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - instance of PwsPassphrase
        Returns:
        true if and only if obj is not null, of type PwsPassphrase and its cleartext value is identical with the corresponding value of this instance

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hashcode value coherent with equals() for this passphrase, based on its cleartext value.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        int hashcode

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a hexadecimal text representation of the encrypted stored value. For an empty value the empty string is returned.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String
